review_title: An ambitious organisation makes for a challenging but rewarding job!
job_title: Operations Staff in Haywards Heath, England
pros:
I have 15 years experience of the NGO sector and Sightsavers is definitely in the top league in terms of clear strategy, compelling vision and mission combined with good systems and a very professional workforce. This enables the organisation to manage a very complex funding base and maximise every pound. The focus is beneficiaries and fixing people's sight. That in itself is very compelling. One just needs to watch the documentary where David Tenant visits one of the organisation's project to see that. 

Also, having been in the organisation for over 5 years, I feel my commitment has often been rewarded with professional growth and new opportunities.
cons: Of course the organisation is ambitious and funding very precious so sometimes Sightsavers has had to make decisions that are very difficult, including making staff redundant or restructuring. That creates bad vibes which are expressed form ti e to time. Also, the mission requires a very high level of commitment, sometimes stressful times and long hours but the end goal is worth it!

review_title: Great organisation and a fantastic place to work
job_title: Planning Director in Haywards Heath, England
pros:
I have worked at the organisation for a number of years and have seen it go from strength to strength and hugely increase the amazing impact it has on people in the countries in which we work. The work the organisation does has a transformational affect on people's lives in some of the most disadvantaged parts of the world.

It has always been a great place to work but in recent years has stepped up in all ways - strong leadership, increased professionalism and a very clear understanding of what it needs to achieve.  Any one who has ability and drive will enjoy being part of this organisation.
cons: There is little to say here.  The organisation is ambitious and there is never enough funding to do everything it would like to do but it still continues to extend it's influence year after year.

job_title: in Haywards Heath, England
pros: There are some very talented people working at Sightsavers, especially in programmes, research and policy. Many great things are achieved for the people in need of the services that Sightsavers provide.
cons: The organisation is poisoned by a culture of bullying driven by the CEO and supported by the senior management team. The checks and balances that should prevent this, trustees and the HR dept, are respectively kept in the dark and working without a director so that the CEO can hire and fire at will and without any independent checks. The cronyism that prevails, with many highly paid consultants acting as employees and basic employment law completely ignored, has created a palpable atmosphere of fear. Complaints and grievances are smothered and concealed from view.
